description: The Notification() constructor shows a message to the user, typically using the notification system of the host operating system.
description_html: The Notification() constructor shows a message to the user, typically using the notification system of the host operating system.
name: Notifications

notes: Starting in Chrome 49, notifications do not work in incognito mode.
Before Chrome 42, service worker additions were not supported.

chrome_android.notes: A notification can only be sent from a service worker. To show a notification, see ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification().

oculus.notes: A notification can only be sent from a service worker. To show a notification, see ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification().

notes: Starting in Opera 36, notifications do not work in incognito mode.
Before Opera 29, service worker additions were not supported.
Notifications in Opera for Android are only available through service workers. To show notifications on Android, see ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification().
Starting in Opera for Android 36, notifications do not work in incognito mode.
The Notification interface is undefined, unless the page is a web app saved to the home screen. The app's manifest must have a non-default display value.
A notification can only be sent from a service worker. To show a notification, see ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification().
Notifications in Samsung Internet are only available through service workers. To show notifications on Android, see ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification().
Starting in Samsung Internet 5.0, notifications do not work in incognito mode.
A notification can only be sent from a service worker. To show a notification, see ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification().
This constructor always throws a TypeError exception.
A notification can only be sent from a service worker. To show a notification, see ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification().
This constructor always throws a TypeError exception.
A notification can only be sent from a service worker. To show a notification, see ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification().
This constructor always throws a TypeError exception.
This constructor throws a ReferenceError exception, unless the page is a web app saved to the home screen. The app's manifest must have a non-default display value.
A notification can only be sent from a service worker. To show a notification, see ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification().
A notification can only be sent from a service worker. To show a notification, see ServiceWorkerRegistration.showNotification().
This constructor always throws a TypeError exception.

safari.notes: The property can be set, but has no effect.

safari_ios.notes: The property can be set, but has no effect.
The parent Notification interface is undefined unless the page is a web app saved to the home screen. The app's manifest must have a non-default display value.

notes: From Firefox 70 onwards, cannot be called from a cross-origin iframe.
From Firefox 72 onwards, can only be called in response to a user gesture such as a click event.
From Firefox Android 79 onwards, cannot be called from a cross-origin iframe.
From Firefox Android 79 onwards, can only be called in response to a user gesture such as a click event.

safari.notes: Only supported the deprecated callback syntax.

safari_ios.notes: The parent Notification interface is undefined unless the page is a web app saved to the home screen. The app's manifest must have a non-default display value.
